title: If you all seriously think Ekko is a balanced champion
body: Then LeBlanc, Kassadin, and Talon should get their silences back. You all claim that an assassin with so many safety nets and burst capability is balanced but then cry when there's a mechanism to shut that cancerous shit down. Give back silence to these three if you're gonna keep making more champions like Ekko, cause it is hypocritical for them to be nerfed while you release these monsters and give them love taps.

replies.body:
You see, the problem here is while the damage and utility {{champion:245}} provides is unreliable and/or delayed, {{champion:7}} {{champion:91}} and {{champion:38}} pretty much just click on you and blow you apart in a second while also having point and click silences to potentially keep you from doing anything about it (that is, if you manage to survive :P).

There are multiple mechanisms to shut {{champion:245}} down besides "I click to keep you from casting spells **AND** burst you down in a second! Muahhahaha!!!".

So you're saying they shouldn't have point and click silences, because they're not skill shots?

That's my least favorite thing to argue about, it's also proving the fact that they're turning League of Legends into a game about more skill than strategy.

No, I'm saying you can't have point click CC, and point click intsa-popping power, **AND** powerful engaging tools. 

Strategy is good, but CC in this manner would ruin it. The only "strategy" would be to not be a caster, where as other CC, skillshots, and on click alike, are made so that both parties can take advantage of positioning, timing, and the champs strengths and weaknesses.

Ekko's Shield, Stun, Slow, Passive extra damage, whatever you want to call it is a very huge part of his kit, it's his most overloaded spell. I honestly wouldn't mind Ekko if they just nerfed that w passive, It literally makes him such a good farmer and gives him such a strong early it's ridiculous. It's like a little bit worse version of Zed's actual passive. 

And if the stun and slow went something like this

1.5/1.75/2/2.25/2.5 (which max level it is a longer stun than it is now)
and slow decreased over 2 seconds from 40%

Honestly Ekko would still be great, but it would remove the power to have an extremely stupid fucking strong lane bullying phase, but still increase his late game potential on the stun landing.

Edit: Ekko is point and click insta popping, strong engage power. I honestly don't know what you're saying here, or what your argument is. Since a lot of his damage comes from Ult and basic attacks. Ekko's Ult punishes any chasers preventing any kills when he escapes.

However I do agree on the nerfs Riot did to Kassadin and LB, not the newest pointless ones that made Kassadin tier 4, but when they removed that god awful silence. I'm just saying they're kind of pulling a Kassadin. They remove most of Kassadin's mobility, and his silence, but they they give Ekko insane engage power, and CC in one ability.

>it's also proving the fact that they're turning League of Legends into a game about more skill than strategy.

I thought that was the designer's intent in the first place.

Because Garen is an assassin that can instantly burst you down.

That was sarcasm.
Well, why do you think they removed DFG?

Exactly this. Only the fact Ekko's abilities are telegraphed makes him not broken.

He can be counterplayed so easily if you know him well.

And it's an assassin hater that talks, I ban LB/Zed and Kata every game, because I most play stuff like Lux or Vel'Koz. When I face Ekko, I dont have much troubles, you can mostly dodge his abilities. Facing one of the others assassins in the most annoying thing in the world.
Lux can actually give Katarina a miserable time in lane before she has the damage to 100-0 Lux.
actually, a good kata can beat almost any lane opponent if she plays right, especially one that is skill shot oriented.

Yes, Kat endures 5 to 7 minutes of misery... then she gets angry and kills you... over and over again, for the next 25 to 35 minutes.  The only way she loses is if she got impatient or angry too early and makes a mistake that you can take advantage of.
Lol maybe i'm just a shitty kat but Lux is the one champ I can never do well against in lane.
It's annoying at first, but she has two skillshots that cost a lot of mana, and you have a free instant escape.  She can auto you a lot, but that's nothing more than an annoyance.

Riot hasn't made enough money off him yet.

His nerfs will come.
Need to release that Championship Ekko first.

Eh.

Those champions' casts are for the most part instant. I'll give that Kassadin's ult isn't overbearing in my opinion, but otherwise yes. 

Ekko gives me more time to react to his spells, so I tolerate him having a little more power than those three. I can say to myself, *"Batter up? I have three seconds to do something."* With Leblanc in particular, I get no warning when she does her instant PaC QRW combo. Talon I don't have issues with (being AD, at least he can take towers faster), and Kassadin isn't overbearing either. 

But I will agree that Ekko is overtuned. I just can tolerate him because I can actually do something about it.
Difference between insta-burst and delayed burst.

Against Ekko, you got three seconds.

The counterplay is making them count.

And if you don't make the most of those three seconds... you don't deserve a single. Extra. One.

I really like what Riot did with Yasuo, tbh. They nerfed him enough times in a row to finally get the community to shut up about it and stop permabanning him, and then quietly buffed him up to a power level several nerfs prior a few patches later once the hysteria around him had died down. Yasuos win rate is 47.5% now, it was 44.5% right before they nerfed his health and MS, and it was 42% after they nerfed those, and he's been sitting at around 47% since they buffed his Q and gave 5 MS back. Sure, but they have to be on a 3 second delay.

Now if you really think that's a reliable cc... well I feel sorry for you. Ekko not OP

I'm in this weird place where I don't think he's over powered, but I recognize how ridiculous it is that he has that much utility as an assassin.

I just think it was a mistake to create him like that, and it makes playing against him sort of annoying for most.

Why should champions get their silence back? I don't remember Ekko having a silence. This seems like a pretty dumb argument for them to "improve" a champion you used to like destroying mid lane with. You're going to need a better leg to stand on if you want Ekko to lose some of his power.

> Why should champions get their silence back? I don't remember Ekko having a silence. This seems like a pretty dumb argument for them to "improve" a champion you used to like destroying mid lane with. You're going to need a better leg to stand on if you want Ekko to lose some of his power.

Yah, his argument is pretty dumb, but i somewhat agree with the conclusion for different reasons. Also, you're making some pretty big assumptions, for all we know op has never played any of the champions mentioned and is simply using their kits to form a bad analogy.

I wasn't aware {{champion:245}} had a point and click silence.

In fact, I wasn't aware he had any point and click cc's of any kind.

Oh wait.

He doesn't.

This thread is just bait for people looking for any reason to cry about ekko.

Learn how to pay attention in fights, and position.

Ekko is all about hardcore capitalizing on your mistakes. The fact so many people think he needs hardcore nerfs is simply because that many people suck and need to improve their own skills.
Technically his passive is a point and click slow it just requires 3 hits.
"point and click" and "requires 3 hits" don't really go together.

Your argument is kind of "I think Ekko is overpowered and doesn't have enough counterplay, so I think we should re-add lack of counterplay to other champions so that they can deal with him.

This is wrong for two reasons:

 - You're trying to fix someone's balance issues by adding more hard-counters to them.  That only affects those specific matchups instead of the overall health of the champion as a whole.  (Counterplay is always a better situation than forced counterpicking.)
 - You're trying to fix someone you perceive as overpowered by making someone else overpowered.  Again, that doesn't help anyone but your chosen champions against Ekko, instead it just makes all other champions fare worse because they might be against Ekko *or* the new Talon/LeBlanc/Kassadin.

If one champion is overpowered or overloaded compared to everyone else, the changes to fix the situation need to be to that one champion, not to random other champions.
ekko tower dives with shield and blinky blink movement then ults to get free escape and heals.... balanced as f***,  get rid of that heal for crying out loud and give him a mana cost

Is that any different than a Fizz diving you with his fish for the kill, then Troll Poling the tower aggro before dashing out? Or a Leblanc doing her distortion combo to you under a tower and jumping back out? I don't seem to see why this is a mechanic that you are having difficulties with. At least with Ekko you see him getting his W ready. Leblanc's combo is instantaneous. She doesn't get a heal, but she doesn't need it. She's safe of tower aggro and free to go about her business while you fester at the fountain. If you are low, you should know better than to just hang around under the tower, regardless of the champion you are facing.

and he is also incapable of bursting you down in time to ult out until he has a buttload of ap, and even then you can dodge a large portion of his damage.  also, read the patch notes genius, they are giving his ult a mana cost.

Yes, let's give those assassins their point and click silences back because BALANCE. They got rid of those silences because they lacked counterplay. They pressed one button on you and then there was no way to fight back, and boom... you're dead. With Ekko, he has NO point and click CC, let alone a silence. His only hard CC has a 3 second delay on it, and that makes it extremely easy to avoid. There was no way to avoid the silences on the old assassins.
Another ekko qq thread.
To be fair talon should get his silence back, he doesn't have the consistent safety of  LB. Zed, Ekko, Katrina, FIzz,  or the sticking power of Akali, Diana

These champions had 0 counterplay(point&click silence with huge burst), you can't even compare them to ekko. He has a 3 second delay on his W and a 4 second delay on ult. If you get hit by these abilities then pls just uninstall.

His ult is almost instant and can be used to dodge other abilities such as Cait's Ultimate, the fact that it pulls him back four seconds isn't so much a delay as it is an indicator. That said, yes, the indicator is an obvious sign of how to avoid his ult, although it is one that's easy to miss in the chaos of a teamfight.
I just realized that ekkos team could have an advantage by using blue skins to camouflage his shadow

This is my opinion but I'd rather face release Ekko than Leblanc, Kassadin, or Talon before the silence removals...

At least I have time to react before being blown up.
I only thing I find anyoing to him is that he's capable to go full tank & still be usefull.
Why cant champs be able to do different things? Him being able to go tank doesnt affect him as an assassin.

I think the issue that people are finding is that he can go tank and still function just about the same. He has decent base damages and scalings, so a little bit of AP on him goes a long way, he has good CC and he heals based on percent of damage taken, so his ult can still do damage in the middle of a teamfight and he can continue to tank for even longer.

It's similar to how people are with Thresh and the fact that he can perform multiple roles without much of a problem. It's awesome that he can do that, but it also makes him feel like he's ahead of the other champions who can't perform to the best of their abilities without building a certain way. 

Honestly it would be awesome if more of the champs in the game were like Ekko with the ability to build multiple paths for different roles and still be useful, but while only he and a few other people have the ability I can see how other people might feel like it's unfair.
